channel.title: math.KT updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.KT updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On the Bogomolov-Positselski Conjecture
item.description: arXiv:2503.09264v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Let $p$ be a prime, we say that a Kummerian oriented pro-$p$ group $(G,\theta)$ has the Bogomolov-Positselski property if $I_\theta(G)$ is a free pro-$p$ group. We give a new criterion for an oriented pro-$p$ group to have the Bogomolov-Positselski property based on previous work by Positselski (arXiv:1405.0965) and Quadrelli and Weigel (arXiv:2103.12438) linking their seemingly unrelated approaches and thereby answering a question posed by Quadrelli and Weigel. Under further assumptions, we derive two additional criteria. The first of which strongly resembles an analogue of the Merkujev-Suslin theorem. The second allows to relax the conditions given by Positselski in Theorem 2 of arXiv:1405.0965. In addition, we show how to make those weaker assumptions computationally effective in some special cases.
item.dc:creator: Julian Feuerpfeil

item.title: A transverse index theorem in the calculus of filtered manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2207.09112v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We use filtrations of the tangent bundle of a manifold starting with an integrable subbundle to define transverse symbols to the corresponding foliation, define a condition of transversally Rockland and prove that transversally Rockland operators yield a K-homology class. We construct an equivariant KK-class for transversally Rockland transverse symbols and show a Poincare duality type result linking the class of an operator and its symbol.
item.dc:creator: Cl\'ement Cren (LAMA)

item.title: Adjoints, wrapping, and morphisms at infinity
item.description: arXiv:2309.17062v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: For a localization of a smooth proper category along a subcategory preserved by the Serre functor, we show that morphisms in Efimov's algebraizable categorical formal punctured neighborhood of infinity can be computed using the natural cone between right and left adjoints of the localization functor. In particular, this recovers the following result of Ganatra--Gao--Venkatesh: morphisms in categorical formal punctured neighborhoods of wrapped Fukaya categories are computed by Rabinowitz wrapping.
item.dc:creator: Tatsuki Kuwagaki, Vivek Shende
